title: I want to operate an Italian ice push cart come next summer.  Since Italian ice is water based and the process of selling it is just scooping the product from its tub into the customers cup, what, if any, health permits do I need?  Italian ice is gluten free, dairy free, and kept below freezing at all times. It poses no allergy risk, so is the rule of mobile vendors needing to operate along side a brick and mortar restaurant still applicable?
text: Here's a link to the answer to your question. http://www.myreporter.com/2014/10/health-permits-need-sell-italian-ice/
